$interpreted: Barbara: ...Who is it?
???: You found me? Truly worthy to be called Headmaster~
???: Why the anxious look? Weren't you the one who sent us the message?
Barbara: So you're the one the Dracontines sent...Does this mean that you are willing to help me?
???: That depends. Currently, this has merely piqued our interest.
Barbara: Though I haven't dealt with the Dracontines in the past...
Barbara: ...it would be polite to reveal your face when talking to someone you've not met.
Zola: Nice to meet you, successor to the School of Bequeathers.
Zola: I won't hide this from you. Having not heard from you for some time, we thought that the School of Bequeathers and their Watchers had died long ago.
Barbara: ...It is true that my family are elders in the School of Bequeathers, but I am nonetheless not a member.
Barbara: The true School of Bequeathers...left this world long ago.
Zola: So, you don't wish to carry on the tradition?
Zola: You did use the ancient method of communication between the Dracontines and the Bequeathers.
Zola: Did you just want someone to reflect with you on your family's past glories?
Barbara: Before I received my blessings and officially joined, the Bequeathers suffered massive changes and were destroyed.
Barbara: But I am aware that the Bequeathers and the Dracontines have always cooperated.
Barbara: ...Dietrich's resurrection looks extremely similar to your "reincarnation" technique.
Barbara: I've come to you...
Barbara: ...for your help in determining whether or not this knowledge should be revealed to the world...
Barbara: Whether or not it will endanger the Academy...
Zola: A wise choice, Headmaster. We most certainly can answer this for you.
Zola: However, the relationship between the Dracontines and Bequeathers is such that we must both benefit.
Zola: And what shall the Academy offer in return?
Barbara: As for this...
Barbara: Guinevere! Weren't you following the professor?
Barbara: ...Did more students find the professor?
Zola: ...Shirley, you'll see...
Zola: What the Rune Academy offers must not be frivolous. It must be...a sacrifice.
Annie: Elio! You've returned! OMGGG~~
Betty: We heard someone say the headmaster was protecting a fugitive, so we went looking for you all over the Academy.
Cara: Don't worry, we'll help you, Elio!
Morris: Chevalier, it won't matter if we blow them to high heaven, right?
Tica: L-Let me explain it to 'em first~
Annie: Sooo...Elio's like, the teacher of Headmaster Balzac or something!?
Betty: Sooo...should we call him master or mister?
Cara: Sooo...what about Elio? Headmaster Charle is definitely worried sick...
Morris: Eh? What's the relationship between this young fellow and Charle?
Tica: Elio...he's Charle's adopted son.
Annie: M-M-Mister, can you give Elio back his body?
Annie: Headmaster Charle...he's always regretted not taking more care of Elio...
Morris: Really? Charle?
Betty: Ya...the headmaster is so worried about Elio.

Cara: When Elio disappeared, the headmaster went running around everywhere looking for him! 

That's even the reason why he stepped down from his position as headmaster...
Morris: ......
Morris: (This grief and confusion...is not mine. It's yours, Elio Ceres...)
Tica: Ehhhh? I've got a strange feeling...
Morris: Step back!

Model.Text: ...Who is it?
You found me? Truly worthy to be called Headmaster~
Why the anxious look? Weren't you the one who sent us the message?
So you're the one the Dracontines sent...Does this mean that you are willing to help me?
That depends. Currently, this has merely piqued our interest.
Though I haven't dealt with the Dracontines in the past...
...it would be polite to reveal your face when talking to someone you've not met.
...Hmph.
Nice to meet you, successor to the School of Bequeathers.
I won't hide this from you. Having not heard from you for some time, we thought that the School of Bequeathers and their Watchers had died long ago.
...It is true that my family are elders in the School of Bequeathers, but I am nonetheless not a member.
The true School of Bequeathers...left this world long ago.
So, you don't wish to carry on the tradition?
You did use the ancient method of communication between the Dracontines and the Bequeathers.
Did you just want someone to reflect with you on your family's past glories?
Before I received my blessings and officially joined, the Bequeathers suffered massive changes and were destroyed.
But I am aware that the Bequeathers and the Dracontines have always cooperated.
...Dietrich's resurrection looks extremely similar to your "reincarnation" technique.
I've come to you...
...for your help in determining whether or not this knowledge should be revealed to the world...
Whether or not it will endanger the Academy...
A wise choice, Headmaster. We most certainly can answer this for you.
However, the relationship between the Dracontines and Bequeathers is such that we must both benefit.
And what shall the Academy offer in return?
As for this...
Guinevere! Weren't you following the professor?
...Did more students find the professor?
...Shirley, you'll see...
What the Rune Academy offers must not be frivolous. It must be...a sacrifice.
Elio! You've returned! OMGGG~~
We heard someone say the headmaster was protecting a fugitive, so we went looking for you all over the Academy.
Don't worry, we'll help you, Elio!
Chevalier, it won't matter if we blow them to high heaven, right?
L-Let me explain it to 'em first~
Sooo...Elio's like, the teacher of Headmaster Balzac or something!?
Sooo...should we call him master or mister?
Sooo...what about Elio? Headmaster Charle is definitely worried sick...
Eh? What's the relationship between this young fellow and Charle?
Elio...he's Charle's adopted son.
M-M-Mister, can you give Elio back his body?
Headmaster Charle...he's always regretted not taking more care of Elio...
Really? Charle?
Ya...the headmaster is so worried about Elio.

When Elio disappeared, the headmaster went running around everywhere looking for him! 

That's even the reason why he stepped down from his position as headmaster...
(This grief and confusion...is not mine. It's yours, Elio Ceres...)
Ehhhh? I've got a strange feeling...
Step back!
